revised_title: Observations on the Bansticle, Pricklebag, and Prickleback Fish
tldr: The author describes his observations of the bansticle, or pricklebag, also known as the prickleback fish, and its behavior, including its territorial nature, ability to leap, and its detrimental impact on the spawn and fry of other fish species. He also discusses the fish's armor and spines, as well as the lice that infest them.
